subject: physics
title: Momentum and Conservation of Momentum MCQ Problems

problems.question: What does momentum depend on?
problems.hint: Momentum measures how hard it is to stop a moving object.
problems.detailed: Momentum is defined as \(p = mv\). Both the mass \(m\) and the velocity \(v\) determine the momentum, so the correct answer is C.
problems.author: Nemanja Maslak

problems.question: What is impulse?
options: Force applied to an object without time
Change in momentum of an object
The total mass of a system
problems.hint: Think about how a force acting over time changes motion.
problems.detailed: Impulse equals the force multiplied by the time interval over which it acts: \(J = F \Delta t\). By Newton's second law integrated in time, impulse equals the change in momentum: \(J = \Delta p\). Thus the correct answer is B.
problems.author: Nemanja Maslak

problems.question: According to the law of conservation of momentum, how does the momentum of a closed system change?
options: Depends on the type of objects only
Remains constant unless an external force acts
problems.hint: Consider an isolated two-cart collision with no outside forces.
problems.detailed: In a closed (isolated) system with no external forces, the total momentum is conserved: \(\sum p_{before} = \sum p_{after}\). So the total momentum remains constant unless an external force acts. Answer: D.
problems.author: Nemanja Maslak

problems.question: Two objects collide in a perfectly elastic collision. Which of the following is true?
options: Momentum is conserved, kinetic energy is not
Momentum is not conserved, kinetic energy is conserved
Both momentum and kinetic energy are conserved
Neither momentum nor kinetic energy is conserved
problems.hint: Elastic collisions conserve mechanical energy as well as momentum.
problems.detailed: A perfectly elastic collision conserves both total momentum and total kinetic energy. Therefore both conservation laws hold simultaneously and the correct answer is C.
problems.author: Nemanja Maslak

problems.question: A 2 kg cart moving at 3 m/s collides and sticks to a 3 kg cart at rest. What is the velocity of the combined carts after the collision?
problems.hint: Use conservation of momentum for an inelastic (sticking) collision.
problems.detailed: Before collision: total momentum \(p_{before} = m_1 v_1 + m_2 v_2 = 2 \times 3 + 3 \times 0 = 6 \, \text{kg} \cdot \text{m/s}\). After collision the masses stick, so \((m_1+m_2)v = 5v\). Conservation gives \(5v = 6 \Rightarrow v = 6/5 = 1.2\,\text{m/s}\). Answer: A.
problems.author: Nemanja Maslak
